Articles.Content:
First forum thread. Post your historical probe replicas mod or stock.

Explorer1(Voyager 1)

![screenshot4.png](screenshot4.png)

![screenshot5.png](screenshot5.png)

Hope to see some of your replicas

Welcome to the forums, Voyager275!

If you want us to be able to see your pictures, you're going to have to host them somewhere, I recommend imgur.com. Then you can share them with us. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here is Explorer

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/YdDnJ)

I would like your opinions on my replica and am looking forward to enjoying yours.

Live long and play Kerbal Space Program.
I love replicas. This one looks great. I especially like the way the rover wheel is such a good substitute for the apparatus and instruments on the top of your Voyager 1.

just fresh from completion - stock Lunokhod (if it's ok to count rovers among these replicas ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

[![iuH2KbSl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/iuH2KbSl.jpg)](http://imgur.com/iuH2KbS) 

(and yes, the solar panel starts folded ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) thanks microhinges ^^)

full mission thread (with the Proton-K rocket and the Ye-8 lander) : [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114114-Muna-17-mission](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114114-Muna-17-mission)
Rovers are technically probes if unmanned, so yeah they count
